column2: [(1990)  1 WLR  1545 at 1573] Judge J.  states that "No legitimate expectation could arise  from  an

column1: ultra vires relaxation  of the relevant statute by the body responsible for enforcing it."

column2: The  principle that the court will not give effect to a legitimate expectation where to do so would
involve the decision-maker acting contrary to law is fundamental [Attorney-General of Hong Kong
v.  Ng  Yuen  Shiu  [1983]  2 AC  629  at 638;  R.  v.  North  ond East  Devon  Heolth Authority,  Ex  porte
(2000)  2  WLR  622  at  647,  651,  656;  R  v.  Secretary  of State  for  Education  and

column1: Employment,  Ex parte Begbie (2000) 1 WLR  1115 at 1125, 1132)].
